item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): RPM Trimmer Illumination Very Low
item.description:
After reviving the circuit boards of a Beogram 4002 (5513) turntable, I focused on improving the dim backlighting of the 33 and 45 RPM adjustment scales. I removed the panel containing these adjustments for easier access. Taking off the light covers revealed the bulbs. A closer look showed that the bulbs were not the correct type, leading to the weak illumination. I replaced these bulbs with my custom-designed SMD LED replacements...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Restoration of RPM Trimmer Panel
item.description:
Following the PCB rebuild of a Beogram 4002 (5501) turntable, the author focused on restoring the RPM trimmer panel, which had been previously replaced due to a burned-out illumination bulb. The first step involved re-soldering the connections where the original panel had been cut off and adding heat-shrink tubing for protection. LED replacement boards, specifically designed for the 550x series, were installed to provide similar resistance and current draw as the original bulbs...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Replacement of RPM Trimmer Panel Bulbs with LED Assemblies
item.description:
Following the electronic restoration of a Beogram 4002 (5513) turntable, the next step was to upgrade the light bulbs in the RPM adjustment panel with LED assemblies. This change was made because LEDs offer greater longevity and produce less heat compared to incandescent bulbs. Reduced heat generation is particularly beneficial as it improves the stability of the DC motor responsible for driving the platter. item.title: Beogram 4002 (5523): Replacement of the RPM Trimmer Light Bulbs with LEDs
item.description:
Following the PCB restoration of the Beogram 4002 (5523), the next step was to swap the RPM trimmer illumination bulbs with LEDs. This change enhances the Beogram’s long-term stability and the DC motor’s RPM consistency. The RPM trimmers are integral to the DC motor’s feedback circuit, which maintains a steady RPM. Incandescent bulbs generate heat, affecting the trimmers and potentially causing RPM fluctuations. The cooler-running LEDs effectively address this issue...
